message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.RO, cs.SY, cs.CV. 

The paper proposes a new model-free trajectory-based policy optimization algorithm for control tasks. This algorithm uses a local, quadratic and time-dependent \qfunc~learned from trajectory data instead of a model of the system dynamics. The paper also discusses the limitations of linear approximation of the system dynamics and proposes a policy update scheme that ensures exact KL-constraint satisfaction without simplifying assumptions on the system dynamics. Therefore, the paper is likely to belong to the following arXiv CS sub-categories: 

- cs.LG (Machine Learning): The paper proposes a new model-free trajectory-based policy optimization algorithm that uses a learned \qfunc~and discusses the limitations of linear approximation of the system dynamics. 
- cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence): The paper proposes a new algorithm for control tasks that uses a learned \qfunc~and discusses the limitations of linear approximation of the system dynamics. 
- cs.RO (Robotics): The paper proposes a new algorithm for control tasks and discusses the limitations of linear approximation of the system dynamics, which are relevant to robotics. 
- cs.SY (Systems and Control): The paper proposes a new algorithm for control tasks and discusses the limitations of linear approximation of the system dynamics, which are relevant to systems and control. 
- cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition): Although the paper does not explicitly mention computer vision or pattern recognition, the proposed algorithm could potentially be
